patch_unified:
diff --git a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
index 52685de..ef86f85 100644
--- a/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
+++ b/docs/reference/cluster/health.asciidoc
@@ -37,10 +37,10 @@ index level status is controlled by the worst shard status. The cluster
 status is controlled by the worst index status.
 
 One of the main benefits of the API is the ability to wait until the
-cluster reaches a certain high water-mark health level. For example, the
-following will wait till the cluster reaches the `yellow` level for 50
-seconds (if it reaches the `green` or `yellow` status beforehand, it
-will return):
+cluster reaches a certain health level. For example, the
+following will wait up to 50 seconds for the cluster to reach the `yellow` 
+status level (if it reaches `yellow` or even better, `green`, 
+status before the timeout, it will return immediately):
 
 [source,js]
 --------------------------------------------------
@@ -74,8 +74,10 @@ The cluster health API accepts the following request parameters:
     `lt(N)` notation.
 
 `timeout`::
-    A time based parameter controlling how long to wait if one of
-    the wait_for_XXX are provided. Defaults to `30s`.
+    A time based parameter controlling how long to wait if any of
+    the wait_for_XXX parameters are provided. If the timeout is reached
+    before the desired condition is met, the API returns with the current
+    cluster status and timed_out set to true. Defaults to `30s`.
